MatchedRegions.transcript: Next, we present some qualitative results.

MatchedRegions.transcript: As you can see, the different models are able to correct the wrong predictions after applying their method.

MatchedRegion.Text: INet-A ObjectNet SI-rotation Input Original Ours Input Original Ours Input Original Ours Prad Television Mantis Drill Hand- Golf ball Lemon blower Pridd Garbage- Forklift Ping-pong- Teddy Sea Lion Porcupine truck ball Tram Tank Maze Orange Swimmi- Sock ng trunks Prad Kite Vulture Scale Strainer Lifeboat Cello Snowplow School bus Bathtub Running- Balloon Ruler shoe

MatchedRegions.transcript: For example, the model here predicts that this cool bus is a snowplow due to the presence of the snow in the background.

MatchedRegion.Text: INet-A ObjectNet SI-rotation Input Original Ours Input Original Ours Input Original Ours Prad Television Mantis Drill Hand- Golf ball Lemon blower Pridd Garbage- Forklift Ping-pong- Teddy Sea Lion Porcupine truck ball Tram Tank Maze Orange Swimmi- Sock ng trunks Prad Kite Vulture Scale Strainer Lifeboat Cello Snowplow School bus Bathtub Running- Balloon Ruler shoe

MatchedRegions.transcript: An additional example is this model that classifies the teddy bear as a ping pong ball due to a sports consideration of only its path.

MatchedRegion.Text: INet-A ObjectNet SI-rotation Input Original Ours Input Original Ours Input Original Ours Prad Television Mantis Drill Hand- Golf ball Lemon blower Pridd Garbage- Forklift Ping-pong- Teddy Sea Lion Porcupine truck ball Tram Tank Maze Orange Swimmi- Sock ng trunks Prad Kite Vulture Scale Strainer Lifeboat Cello Snowplow School bus Bathtub Running- Balloon Ruler shoe

MatchedRegions.transcript: In both cases, our method is able to correct the wrong predictions by allowing the model to focus on the correct parts of the image.
